required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Clinic to Community Connections: Enhancing Prenatal to Postpartum Care Transitions to Prevent Type 2 Diabetes in Low Income Women With Gestational Diabetes

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock:
This study addresses education needs in gestational diabetes care and followup at the staff and patient levels.
In the initial phase, nurses and community health workers will complete specific training modules on gestational diabetes developed for this study. The effectiveness of the education modules will be evaluated through pre/post surveys of participants assessing diabetes knowledge, attitudes, and self-efficacy.
Intervention participants will be compared on survey measures before and after the intervention and on health outcomes with 'contemporaneous control' group. Both groups will receive initial gestational diabetes education with trained clinic staff. The intervention group will receive additional education during and after pregnancy with a curriculum delivered by a community health worker. The contemporaneous control will not be enrolled in the study and will be identified retrospectively.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Staff participants will complete surveys on diabetes knowledge, attitudes, and self-efficacy before and after completing online training modules on gestational diabetes. Patient participants will be recruited from our community health center partner at diagnosis of gestational diabetes. These participants will be considered to be in an intervention group and as such will receive a community health worker delivered curriculum including 4 sessions during pregnancy and 3 sessions postpartum. Patients in the intervention group will be compared to a contemporaneous 'control' arm that is not enrolled in the intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Staff - Self-efficacy to provide diabetes education questionnaire (newly developed)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and upon module completion (approximately 3 months)
primary_outcome.description: Pre-Post change in staff participants' perceived self-efficacy to provide diabetes education (Mean score min:1 max 10) high score=more confident

primary_outcome.measure: Patients - Postpartum diabetes screening test completed by 16 weeks postpartum
primary_outcome.description: Usual care v. intervention group - % screened with oral glucose tolerance test, fasting plasma glucose, or A1C (after 12 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Staff - Diabetes Knowledge test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and upon module completion (approximately 3 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in diabetes knowledge measured by multiple choice test (% correct out of 21 items) high score =better knowledge

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - Diabetes Knowledge test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Delivery, approximately 12-14 weeks after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Change in diabetes knowledge measured by multiple choice test (% correct out of 21 items) high score= better knowledge

secondary_outcome.measure: Staff - Diabetes Attitudes (Diabetes Attitudes Scale-3 (DAS-3))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and upon module completion (approximately 3 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in diabetes attitudes measured by 3 subscales of DAS-3 (Mean score min 1, max 5) high score=better attitudes

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - Diabetes Attitudes (Diabetes Attitudes Scale-3 (DAS-3))
secondary_outcome.description: Change in diabetes attitudes measured by 3 subscales of DAS-3 (Mean score min 1, max 5) high score = better attitudes

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients- Diabetes Distress (Problem Areas in Diabetes Scale PAID-5)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in diabetes distress measured by PAID-5 (Sum score min:0, max: 20) higher score=greater distress

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - Risk Perception for Developing Diabetes (RPS-DD) Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Delivery, approximately 12-14 weeks after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Change in risk perception for developing diabetes measured by select items from RPS-DD (2 questions scored individually Min: 1, Max: 4) higher score=better risk perception (sum score: min 1, max 8); higher score=more accurate risk perception

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients -Self Efficacy for Diabetes Self Management Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Change in diabetes self management self efficacy measured by Lorig Diabetes Self-Efficacy Scale (Mean Score Min: 1, Max: 10) higher score=more confident

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - intention to follow recommendations for diabetes prevention activities questionnaire (newly developed)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Delivery, approximately 12-14 weeks after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Change in patient participants' intention to follow recommendations for diabetes prevention measured by a survey developed for this study (mean score; min 1, max 5) higher score= increased intention to perform action

secondary_outcome.measure: Staff - intention to recommend diabetes prevention activities questionnaire (newly developed)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and upon module completion (approximately 3 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in staff's intention to recommend postpartum diabetes screening measured by a survey developed for this study (mean score; min 1, max 5) higher score= increased intention to perform action

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - physical activity self efficacy (Smith Physical Activity Self-Efficacy Scale)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Delivery, approximately 12-14 weeks after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Change in patient participants' physical activity self efficacy using the Smith Physical Activity Self Efficacy Scale (Sum score, min: max:36) higher score=more confident

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - Gestational weight gain
secondary_outcome.description: Weight at delivery - Weight at first prenatal visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - Diabetes medication using in pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Use of insulin or oral medications for diabetes during pregnancy with GDM

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - infant birthweight
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous: Infant birthweight in grams; Dichotomous - LGA (Y/N)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - Cesarean Section
secondary_outcome.description: Dichotomous (Y/N)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - Postpartum diabetes screening test ordered by 12 weeks postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: Dichotomous(Y/N)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - Weight loss in the first postpartum year
secondary_outcome.description: Weight at 1 year postpartum - Weight at delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - Dietary Self- Efficacy (Stitch Dietary Self efficacy scale DIET-SE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Delivery, approximately 12-14 weeks after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Change in self-efficacy for adhering to recommended diet using the Stitch DIET-SE survey (Sum score min: 0, max: 44) higher score=more confident

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - Dietary Self efficacy (Akouhoue Personal Dietary Questionnaire Use of info for Dietary Decision Making)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Delivery, approximately 12-14 weeks after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Change in use of info for dietary decision making using Akouhoue PDQ dietary decision making subscale (Sum score min: 3, Max:18) higher score=more frequent use of dietary information

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - perception of social support (modified Medical outcome survey - social support subscale (MOS-SS))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Delivery, approximately 12-14 weeks after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Social Support (8 item - Sum score min: 8, max:40) higher score=stronger social support

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - preterm birth
secondary_outcome.description: Dichotomous (Y/N, delivery before 37 weeks' gestation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients - NICU stay >24 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Dichotomous (Y/N)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients-Neonatal Hypoglycemia
secondary_outcome.description: Dichotomous (Y/N)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mean 2 week fasting blood glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous - mean 2 week fasting blood glucose prior to delivery - mean 2 week fasting blood glucose after enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mean 2 week postprandial blood glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous mean 2 week postprandial blood glucose prior to delivery - mean 2 week postprandial blood glucose after enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mean # of blood glucose checks per day over 2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous - mean # of daily blood glucose checks per day 2 weeks prior to delivery - mean # of daily blood glucose checks 2 weeks after enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in % of blood glucose checks in goal range (70-140 mg/dl) over 2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous - % of blood glucose checks in goal range 2 weeks prior to delivery - % of blood glucose checks in goal range 2 weeks after enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of prenatal visits
secondary_outcome.description: Ordinal - number of visits to the health center between first prenatal visit and delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of postpartum visits
secondary_outcome.description: Ordinal - number of visits to the health center between delivery and 1 year postpartum

other_outcome.measure: Implementation outcome: Reach of patient intervention
other_outcome.description: Number of patients enrolled/Number of patients with GDM

other_outcome.measure: Implementation outcome: Adoption of patient intervention
other_outcome.description: Mean number of education sessions completed

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 25-29 wks gestation(wg), 26-30 wg, 32-36 wg; 2-4 wks postpartum, 6-8 weeks postpartum, 12-14 weeks postpartum
other_outcome.description: # of checklist items completed for each session/# total checklist items
Completion rate of education sessions in pregnancy and postpartum
General Self Efficacy measure (for use in validation of the Self-Efficacy for Providing Diabetes Education Scale) Sum Score (min: 10, max: 40); higher score=more confidence

other_outcome.measure: Staff-Provider Teaching Motivation Questionnaire Intrinsic Motivation Subscale
other_outcome.description: Measure of teaching motivation (for use in validation of the Self-Efficacy for Providing Diabetes Education Scale) Mean score (min: 0, max 4) higher score=more intrinsic motivation

arm_group.description: Patients with gestational diabetes not participating in the intervention arm receiving usual care at community health center
Patient participants with gestational diabetes receiving usual care at community health center plus patient-centered educational curriculum and support from a community health worker.
Nurses, community health workers, and others involved in maternal healthcare

intervention.intervention_name: Usual Care + Community health worker delivered patient education curriculum
intervention.description: Patient participants will receive usual care from trained health center staff. They will also receive 4 education sessions during pregnancy and 3 sessions postpartum with a trained community health worker.

Patients receive usual care from trained health center staff. Note that his arm has changed and is not being actively recruited. Outcomes from eligible non-participants in the intervention will be compared to intervention participants from the same time period. Usual care group will be identified retrospectively via partial HIPAA waiver.

Nurses and community health workers will complete 4 hours of online modules on gestational diabetes - Module 1: GDM Disease, Diagnosis and Complications; Module 2: Nutrition and Physical Activity Management; Module 3: Monitoring, Medications, and Avoiding Hypoglycemia; Module 4: Future Diabetes Risk and Prevention. Effectiveness of the training will be evaluated with pre/post evaluation of diabetes knowledge, attitudes, and self efficacy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Clinic staff: nurses (RN, LPN, BSN), community health workers, and others involved in maternal child health care
Patients:
- women 18 and older
- receiving care at community health center partner (Affinia Healthcare)
- GDM as diagnosed by Carpenter-Coustan criteria
- enrolled between 13 and 33 weeks' gestation
- Primary language English or Spanish
Exclusion Criteria:
Clinic staff: individuals not involved in maternal child health care or who do not consent to participate in study
Patients
- women under 18;
- women with GDM that are more than 33 weeks' gestation at enrollment
- Primary language not English or Spanish
- women with developmental disability or psychiatric comorbidity that inhibits participation in intervention
